comments:
When starting eclipse, I get a dialog saying "Problems during startup. Check the
.log file in the .metadata directory of your workspace".

This is in the logfile:
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Dec 25, 2003 18:51:31.760
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:84)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)


I'm running this command from within the eclipse directory:
/usr/local/devtools/eclipse/eclipse -data /home/marcus/eclipsews -vm \
/opt/sun-j2sdk-1.4.1/bin/javax

I've also tried adding
/usr/local/devtools/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk_3.0.0/os/linux/x86 to
the LD_LIBRARY_PATH. Didnt change anything though (same error message on startup).

My System:
- Gentoo (2.4.20-gentoo-r6)
- gnome 2.4.0
- eclipse-SDK-3.0M6-linux-gtk.zip
- jvm: 1.4.1 (sun)

Also:
- After giving up trying to install 3M6, I tried installing 2.1.2 GTK on the
same machine. It worked straight away.

If anyone wants strace logs or things like that - feel free to contact me.

Created an attachment (id=7280)
output of strace when attempting to launch eclipse 3M6GTK

Added strace output from when trying to launch eclipse v3.0 M6 GTK

Eclipse is not supported under Gentoo Linux but I'll move this bug to Equinox
for comment in case the problem is general and not platform specific. (seems
similar to bug 49379)

Hi,

I'm very surprise by this bug because I'm using gentoo both at home and at work
with Eclipse 3.0 M6 GTK and it work fine!

My system:
   - 2.4.20-gentoo-r8
   - gnome 2.4.0
   - eclipse-SDK-3.0M6-linux-gtk.zip
   - sun-jdk 1.4.2_02-b03

REM: I havn't installed eclipse using an ebuild (just unzip under /opt/)

This is probably not specific to "gentoo" (whatever that is).  I get the same 
think on Windows XP (Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600]) when trying to 
launch 3.0 M6.  Unless that's just a coincidence...

A number of changes went in for things which may be related to this.  Can you 
confirm if it is fixed for you in I0121 ?

I obtained the similar log trace while running Eclipse 3.0M6 as follows:
  eclipse -data f:\eclipse-ws3

The f: drive is mapped to files and folders running Windows Offline Files and 
File Folders.  When I switched to local file folder, the problem did not occur.
  eclipse -data c:\eclipse-ws3

This same problem does not occur in Eclipse 2.1.2 (i.e., using f:\eclipse-ws2).

Beware here of issues related to java.nio.  I recall hearing that there were 
some issues with nio on certain configurations.  May not be related but thought 
I would put it in the pot and see what happens.

There have been many changes which might affect this scenario.  Is anyone still 
seeing this problem?  If not we will close at M8
